question: The UNESCO World Heritage Site "Scandola Nature Reserve" is located in which country?
explanation: Scandola Nature Reserve is located in Corsica Island, one of the 18 regions of France. It forms part of the Regional Natural Park of Corsica. The French government passed a law in 1930 for the protection of this nature park. It forms part of the UNESCO World Heritage Site "Gulf of Porto: Calanche of Piana, Gulf of Girolata, Scandola Reserve". This nature reserve occupies the Scandola peninsula which is an impressive, porphyritic rock mass. This nature reserve houses scrubland vegetation. The clear waters of this nature reserve host a rich marine life which also includes seagulls, cormorants, and sea eagles.
